params._tokenTo: The address of the token we want to convert to

convert(address,address,uint256).details: _convert is separate to save gas by only checking the 'onlyEOA' modifier once in case of convertMultiple

params.slippage: The accepted slippage, in basis points aka parts per 10,000 so 5000 is 50%
params.token0: The address of the first token of the pair that will be converted
params.token1: The address of the second token of the pair that will be converted

convertMultiple(address[],address[],uint.details: _convert is separate to save gas by only checking the 'onlyEOA' modifier once in case of convertMultiple

params.slippage: The accepted slippage, in basis points aka parts per 10,000 so 5000 is 50%
params.token0: The list of addresses of the first token of the pairs that will be converted
params.token1: The list of addresses of the second token of the pairs that will be converted

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

_bridges.details: Maps a token `token` to another token `bridge` so that it uses `token/bridge` pair to convert token

addAuth(address).notice: Adds a user to the authorized addresses

convert(address,address,uint256).notice: Converts a pair of tokens to tokenTo

convertMultiple(address[],address[],uint.notice: Converts a list of pairs of tokens to tokenTo

devCut().notice: In basis points aka parts per 10,000 so 5000 is 50%, cap of 50%, default is 0

getAuth(uint256).notice: Return the list of authorized addresses

lenAuth().notice: Return the length of authorized addresses

removeAuth(address).notice: Remove a user of authorized addresses

setDevAddr(address).notice: Sets `devAddr`, the address that will receive the `devCut`

setDevCut(uint256).notice: Sets dev cut, which will be sent to `devAddr`, can't be greater than 50%

setTokenToAddress(address).notice: Sets token that we're buying back

userdoc.notice: MoneyMaker receives 0.05% of the swaps done on Trader Joe in the form of an LP. It swaps those LPs to a token of choice and sends it to the JoeBar
